VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Generate Dynamic Sitemaps for Storefront Categories

A sitemap provides a list of your site’s URLs, and metadata about each URL, that you want search engine bots to crawl. Search engines use a sitemap to learn more about the structure of your site. If a site has thousands of pages, a sitemap is especially useful to make sure that search engine bots crawl all of your content. When a site has multiple sitemaps, a sitemap index links all sitemaps from one location.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create, customize, or publish an Experience Cloud site:	

Create and Set Up Experiences

AND

View Setup and Configuration


To set Visualforce page security:	Manage Profiles and Permission Sets

B2B Commerce for Visualforce can generate a sitemap for each category. Each entry links to the Product Detail page of a product assigned to that category. B2B Commerce for Visualforce also creates a sitemap index that links search engine bots to each sitemap. The sitemaps and sitemap index update dynamically as your records change, so you can avoid the extra hassle of maintaining your sitemaps after you create them.

NOTE

A product appears in a sitemap only if it meets the following requirements:

The product belongs to a price list that your storefront's guest users are entitled to.
The product belongs to a category. A sitemap excludes any product that doesn’t have an assigned category.
The product has a status of Released or Not Orderable.
The product’s Start Date and End Date are valid.

A category has an associated sitemap only when it contains at least one product that meets all the product requirements. The sitemap index excludes a category that has no products assigned or that contains only subcategories.

To get started, update your Experience Cloud site to enable the Visualforce pages that generate the sitemaps and sitemap index.

From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
From the Administration menu, select Pages, and then click Go to Force.com.
Scroll to the Site Visualforce Pages section and click Edit.
Select the following pages from the Available Visualforce Pages list (1), add them to the Enabled Visualforce Pages list (2), and click Save.
ccrz.CCCatSiteMap
ccrz.ccSiteIndex
To check out your sitemap index and sitemaps, navigate to the following URLs.
DESTINATION	URL
Sitemap index	https://domain/storefront/ccrz__CCSiteIndex
Sitemap for a category	https://domain/storefront/ccrz__CCCatSiteMap?categoryId=categoryID
TIP
A sitemap can contain at most 10,000 links. If you have more than 10,000 products assigned to a category and you want a sitemap that links to all of them, generate a custom sitemap. Create a custom Visualforce page that replaces the default ccrz.CCCatSiteMap page, or generate a sitemap from another source and use it in your domain. When you create a custom sitemap, also create a custom robots.txt file to point search engine bots to your custom sitemap.
To ensure that your sitemap URLs are complete, verify that you’ve specified a Site Secure Domain for your storefront in CC Admin | Storefront Name | General.
If you set up friendly URLs, the ccrz.CCCatSiteMap page uses your friendly URL values.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later:
If you enable canonical and alternate language URLs, the sitemap uses canonical URLs.
If your storefront supports multiple locales, the sitemap includes only the canonical URL, which specifies the storefront guest user's locale. The sitemap doesn't include any of your alternate language links.
Are you using B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later with an Experience Builder page as your storefront's Home page? To include the Experience Builder page sitemap in your sitemap index, first manually generate a sitemap from Experience Builder. Then, set the Lightning Community Sitemap configuration in the User Interface module to TRUE. For more information, see Specify the Destination for Links to Your Storefront's Home Page.
IMPORTANT The default ccrz.CCSiteIndex page defines behavior for up to 10,000 price list items, which provides a starting point when you first create your storefront. If a guest user is entitled to more than 10,000 price list items, create a custom sitemap index that handles the added volume. Create a custom Visualforce page that replaces the default ccrz.CCSiteIndex page, or generate a sitemap index from another source and use it in your domain. When you create a custom sitemap index, also create a custom robots.txt file to point search engine bots to your custom sitemap index.
